basics.name: Matthew Crown
basics.label: Bioinformatician/Computational Biologist
basics.summary: Computational biologist/bioinformatician with experience working in protein structure, ligand interactions and microbial informatics.

courses: Thesis title: Global, viral and protein scale functional annotation tools for -omics and structural bioinformatics.
Dissertation title: Proteomic analysis of the E3-ubiquitin ligase DTX3L interactome

work.name: COVID19 Sequencing Group, Northumbria University
work.summary: Part of the COVID19 Genomics Consortium (COG-UK) Sequencing efforts at Northumbria University and developed a novel structural and functional annotation tool for SARS-CoV-2 proteins (see Projects). Undertook routine analysis of SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data as part of the sequencing efforts, including running and troubleshooting Nextflow pipelines, handling sensitive metadata linkage, and developing SOPs.

work.name: Exploratory Biomarkers Group, GlaxoSmithKline
work.summary: 1-year industrial placement. The focus of work was development and optimisation of assays to support preclinical/clinical safety and efficacy studies of large and small molecule drugs. Utilised commercial immunoassay and flow cytometry platforms and performed downstream data analysis.

publications.name: ProCogGraph: A graph-based mapping of cognate ligand domain interactions
publications.summary: (first author) Developed a graph database of protein domain:ligand interactions, and used this to explore the types of interactions proteins have with their cognate (i.e. in vivo) ligands.

publications.name: OMEinfo: global geographic metadata for -omics experiments
publications.summary: (first author) Developed a tool for geospatial metadata annotation to provide globally consistent metadata, which I found to be inconsistent in some built-environment microbiome studies. OMEinfo has wide applicability to any studies which utilise location as a feature of interest.

publications.name: SPEAR: Systematic ProtEin AnnotatoR
publications.summary: (first author) Developed a tool for structural and functional annotation of all proteins in the SARS-CoV-2 genome, to assist in identification of potentially important variants at point of sequencing.

publications.name: Bacterial Diversity in House Dust: Characterization of a Core Indoor Microbiome
publications.summary: (co-author) I performed data analysis of 16S built-environment microbiome samples, using Kraken2 for taxonomic annotation and various R packages for statistical analysis of results.

publications.name: Environmental microbiome in the home and daycare settings during the {COVID}-19 pandemic, and potential risk of non-communicable disease in children
publications.summary: (co-author) I performed data analysis of 16S built-environment microbiome samples, using Kraken2 for taxonomic annotation and various R packages for statistical analysis of results.
